TextBlock.Text: OENO: These fish seem to lay their eggs within the bark of these trees. The trees at the <color=orange>North Pole</color> are their favored spot for laying eggs, it seems.
CLARY: The placement of the gravity crystals is very convenient for viewing these fish and their interesting ways.
AVENS: Clary, all these fish exhibit an unusual five eyes each. This trait is worth documenting along with their egg-laying habits.
OENO: In addition, I'll be counting the eggs and studying how they adapt to tidal changes.
CLARY: The extra eyes caught our attention when we first arrived. Oeno documented the event, storing a recording in an archive room at <color=orange>Brittle Hollow's Gravity Cannon</color>.

AVENS: I cannot stay any longer. I must return to <color=orange>Giant's Deep</color> shortly to resume construction of the <color=orange>Orbital Probe Cannon</color>, but I thank you for inviting me to observe these creatures!
OENO: I am glad that you could join us, your presence added to our observations! I will continue my observations over the next few tidal cycles.
